intro: Diasperus meyerianus, commonly known as the Meyer's spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its milky sap, which is a common feature among members of this family. The plant typically grows as a low-growing shrub with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small yellow flowers that are clustered in complex inflorescences called cyathia. Diasperus meyerianus is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
